content.webTitle: Tchenguiz leads field  to buy 2,000 Spirit pubs

fields.headline: Tchenguiz leads field  to buy 2,000 Spirit pubs
fields.bodyText: Multimillionaire property tycoon Robert Tchenguiz is leading the auction for Spirit Group with an offer thought to value the 2,000-strong pub business at £2.8bn. His offer is so far said to exceed that of the main rival suitor, Punch Taverns. Mr Tchenguiz's bid would be financed by Icelandic bank Kaupthing and Barclays. It includes a beer supply agreement with Scottish & Newcastle, which two years ago sold 1,500 pubs to Spirit. A year ago, Mr Tchenguiz acquired 360 smaller Spirit pubs, converting them to tenanted sites which are operated under contract by S&N.
